message:
WEEK 2 — Accumulation Phase

Building on Week 1's foundation. Competition lifts 2-3x/week: 5×5 squat (Mon), 5×5 bench (Tue), 5×4 deadlift (Thu), plus volume bench Saturday. RPE 7-8 (~70-75% 1RM). If Week 1 felt RPE 7, add 5-10lbs. If RPE 8.5, hold weight and focus on bar speed.

This Week:
- Mon: Squat (5×5) + pause squats
- Tue: Bench (5×5) + close-grip bench
- Wed: Rest/active recovery
- Thu: Deadlift (5×4) + deficit DL + front squat
- Fri: Rest
- Sat: Volume bench (4×8) + accessories
- Sun: Rest

Intensity: RPE 7-8 (moderate)
Volume: 4-5 sets per main lift

Secondary variations address weak points. Accessories 3-4 sets × 8-12 reps. Track: weight, reps, RPE, bar speed. Sleep 7-8hr, eat at slight surplus.
qualityNotes: Assumes powerlifting knowledge (references competition lifts, secondary variations)
Explicit progression guidance based on Week 1 RPE (if RPE 7 → add weight, if RPE 8.5 → hold weight)
Bar speed emphasized as fatigue indicator
Training frequency clearly stated (2-3x per lift across week)
Upper/Lower split structure (Mon/Tue squat/bench, Thu/Sat deadlift/volume bench)
Rest days explicitly marked (Wed/Fri/Sun)
Secondary variations noted (pause squats, close-grip bench, deficit DL)
Volume and intensity parameters specified (4-5 sets, RPE 7-8, 70-75% 1RM)
Accessory prescription included (3-4 sets × 8-12 reps)
Recording instructions comprehensive (weight, reps, RPE, bar speed)
Sleep and nutrition guidance (7-8hr, slight surplus)
Confident, direct tone appropriate for advanced trainees

message:
WEEK 6 — Wave Loading 82.5%

Mid-strength block. Loads increase to 82.5% for 4×3 on all comp lifts (Week 5 was 80%, Week 7 will be 85%). RPE 8-9—only 1-2 reps in reserve. Bar speed is critical: if 3rd rep grinds (>3sec), reduce load 5-10lbs.

This Week:
- Mon: Squat (4×3 @ 82.5%)
- Tue: Bench (4×3 @ 82.5%)
- Wed: Rest (CNS recovery)
- Thu: Deadlift (4×2-3 @ 82.5%)
- Fri: Rest
- Sat: Volume bench (3×6-8 @ 70-75% of Tue)
- Sun: Rest

Intensity: RPE 8-9 (heavy)
Volume: 4 sets × 3 reps (12 total reps)

Accessories reduced to 3 sets × 6-8 reps. Variations eliminated—comp lifts only. Week 7 peaks at 85%, then Week 8 deload dissipates fatigue before peaking phase. Trust the wave.
qualityNotes: Wave loading context provided (Week 5: 80%, Week 6: 82.5%, Week 7: 85%)
Specific percentage and set×rep scheme (4×3 @ 82.5%)
RPE target with precision (8-9, only 1-2 reps in reserve)
Bar speed as load adjustment trigger (if 3rd rep >3sec, reduce 5-10lbs)
CNS recovery explicitly noted (Wednesday rest after heavy squat/bench)
Deadlift rep flexibility acknowledged (4×2-3, some lifters only do doubles at 82.5%)
Volume bench clearly defined as percentage of Tuesday's load (70-75%)
Accessory reduction strategy noted (3 sets × 6-8 reps, down from 3-4 sets × 8-12)
Variations eliminated (comp lifts only—no more pause squats, deficit DLs)
Forward-looking context (Week 7 peaks, Week 8 deload, then peaking phase)
'Trust the wave' reinforces periodization strategy
Tone assumes advanced understanding (no explanation of wave loading concept)

message:
WEEK 10 — Heavy Doubles 92.5%

Peaking block week 2. You're lifting 92.5% for 3×2 on comp lifts. RPE 9.5—1st rep decent speed, 2nd rep will slow but should complete clean. If bar stalls or form breaks, weight's too heavy. Competition > hitting percentages.

This Week:
- Mon: Squat (3×2 @ 92.5%)
- Tue: Bench (3×2 @ 92.5%, spotter mandatory)
- Wed: Rest (CNS recovery mandatory)
- Thu: Deadlift (3×1-2 @ 92.5%, singles acceptable)
- Fri: Rest
- Sat: Light bench (2×5 @ 60-65%), light accessories
- Sun: Rest

Intensity: RPE 9.5 (near-maximal)
Volume: 6 total reps per lift

Accessories eliminated or 2×8-10 maintenance only. NO conditioning. Sleep 8-9hr non-negotiable. Week 11: heavy singles (95-97.5%). Week 12: taper + compete. You're on track.
qualityNotes: Peaking context provided (Week 10 of 11-week peaking block, Week 12 is competition)
Near-maximal intensity acknowledged (92.5%, RPE 9.5)
Realistic bar speed expectations (1st rep decent, 2nd rep will slow)
Safety-first mentality ('If bar stalls or form breaks, weight's too heavy')
Competition prioritization ('Competition > hitting percentages')
Spotter explicitly required (Tuesday bench at 92.5%)
Deadlift flexibility (3×1-2, singles acceptable at this intensity)
Wednesday rest marked as 'mandatory' (CNS recovery after 92.5% squat/bench)
Saturday work clearly defined as 'light' (2×5 @ 60-65%)
Accessories strategy: 'eliminated or 2×8-10 maintenance only'
Conditioning explicitly prohibited (NO conditioning—energy preservation)
Sleep prescription upgraded (8-9hr 'non-negotiable')
Forward-looking roadmap (Week 11: heavy singles, Week 12: taper + compete)
'You're on track' provides confidence/reassurance
Tone is terse, technical, competition-focused
